summary: PRRS is an enveloped, positive-sense ssRNA virus. the virus encodes two long non-structural polyproteins, pp1a and pp1ab. innate immune response recognizes viral infections through host pattern recognition receptors (PRRs) pathogen-associated molecular patterns trigger type I IFN expression through the activation of retinoic acid-inducible gene I (RIG-I)-like receptors and Toll-like receptors. RIG-I and melanoma differentiation-associated protein 5 (MDA5) form a known receptor for intracellular viral dsRNA. PRRSV 3CLSP inhibits IFN- production stimulated by Sendai virus (SeV) through mediation of MAVS cleavage. pigs do not invoke a type I IFN response. 3CLSP inhibits the promoter activation of IFN-, IRF3 and NF-B. 3CLSP inhibits the promoter activation of IFN-, IRF3 and NF-B. 3CLSP disrupts RIG-I/MDA5 signalling for activation of both IRFs and NF-B. PRRSV 3CLSP blocks IFN- expression by cleaving MAVS MAVS is a crucial adaptor protein in the antiviral signalling pathway. MAVS acts as a shared bridge protein between IRF3 and NF-B signalling. PRRSV 3CLSP cleaves MAVS at 32 h after co-transfection. hek-293T cells were transfected with flag-tagged MAVS expression plasmids. at 32 h after co-transfection, the cells were collected and analysed. 3CLSP activity is responsible for MAVS cleavage. hek-293T cells were transfected with flag-tagged MAVS expression plasmids. the cells were analysed by Western blotting using rabbit anti-MAVS antibody. proteasome pathways, MAVS expression plasmids and plasmids encoding 3CLSP were transfected into HEK-293T cells. at 24 h post-transfection, the cells were treated with the caspase inhibitor z-VAD-FMK or the proteasome inhibitor MG132 for 8 h. the results showed that neither z-VAD-FMK nor MG132 affected MAVS cleavage by 3CLSP. PRRSV 3CLSP cleaved MAVS at E268, which is located between the PRO domain and TM domain. two MAVS cleavage mutants, the N-terminal fragment (aa 1–268) and C-terminal fragment (aa 269–540) of MAVS were constructed. neither fragment (aa 1–268 and aa 269–540) was capable of efficiently activating any of the three promoters. nsp4 antagonizes IFN- expression through 3CLSP-mediated MAVS cleavage. results indicated that the cleavage site is at E268. type I IFNs are secreted cytokines and have multifunctional roles in antiviral defence and adaptive immunity. cleavage of the adaptor protein MAVS is important to mediate host innate immune activity. canine hepacivirus NS3 serine protease and coxsackievirus B 3Cpro can cleave the adaptor proteins MAVS and TRIF. 3CLSP-mediated cleavage of MAVS was identified as an alternative molecular mechanism of type I IFN evasion used by PRRSV. MAVS is composed of an N-terminal CARD domain, PRO domain and C-terminal TM domain. this cleavage renders MAVS incapable of activating the IFN- promoter. nsp4 blocked the IFN signalling pathway by cleaving MAVS.
